arm_group.description: Participants will consume oatmeal breakfast daily for 4 weeks
Participants will consume a frosted flakes breakfast daily for 4-weeks
Participants will consume no breakfast for a 4-week period

brief_summary.textblock:
Regular breakfast consumption may help lower body weight reduce body fatness and improve
      cardiovascular disease risk factors. However, the best kind of breakfast to consume to
      achieve these effects is unclear. We hypothesized that a high fiber breakfast would suppress
      appetite, lower body weight and improve cardiovascular disease risk factors compared with a
      no-fiber breakfast.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Different Fiber Breakfasts on Appetite and Weight Change in Overweight Subjects

detailed_description.textblock:
Participants will report to the hospital cafeteria between 0800 and 0900h following an
      overnight fast every weekday for 4 consecutive weeks. On arrival, participants will be
      provided will the allocated breakfast and will be given 15 min to consume all the foods
      provided. The oatmeal breakfast will consist of 80g dry oatmeal (Quaker Quick Oats) prepared
      with 120mL fat-free milk and 230mL water. The frosted flakes breakfast will consist of 62g
      frosted flakes and 160mL whole milk and 190mL water served on the side. The No-breakfast
      (control) will consist of only 350mL plain water. All participants will also receive 200mL
      decaffeinated coffee with 12mL non-dairy creamer and 1g packet of non-caloric sweetener. On
      Friday of each week participants will be provided with two portions of the breakfasts to
      take home at consume on the weekend days. On the first day of the intervention and weekly
      thereafter participants will complete 3hr subjective appetite ratings responses to the
      breakfast. Laboratory assessments including body weight, composition, blood pressure and a
      fasting blood sample will be collected before the start of the intervention and at the end
      of the intervention.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  BMI >27kg/m2

          -  Weight stable (<5% weight change in past 3 months)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Smokers

          -  Regular use of medications

          -  Currently undertaking a weight-loss or exercise program

          -  Females who are pregnant or lactating

intervention.description: A breakfast consisting of Frosted Flakes and milk
A breakfast consisting of plain water

clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Ingesting Breakfasts Varying in Fiber on Appetite and Weight Change in Overweight Subjects

other_outcome.description: Systolic and diastolic blood pressure will be measured at baseline and following 4-week intervention

overall_official.affiliation: New York Obesity Nutrition Research Center

primary_outcome.description: Body weight will be measured at baseline and following 4-week breakfast intervention
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in body weight over 4 week intervention

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: New York Obesity and Nutrition Research Center

secondary_outcome.description: Ratings of hunger and Fullness will be collected on a 6 point rating scale with 0 labelled not at all, 40 moderately, 60 quite, 80 very and 100 extremely.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Appetite ratings in response to breakfast will be collected for 3hs on the first day of the study and after 1, 2, 3 and 4 weeks of the intervention

secondary_outcome.description: A fasting blood sample will be collected and analyzed for glucose, insulin, triacylglycerol, leptin and cholesterol
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in plasma metabolic risk factors

secondary_outcome.description: Resting energy expenditure measurements will be collected whilst subjects are fasting, resting in a semi-supine position under thermoneutral conditions with a ventilated hood and metabolic cart.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Resting energy expenditure will be measured at baseline and following the 4 week intervention

clinical_study.source: New York Obesity and Nutrition Research Center

lead_sponsor.agency: New York Obesity and Nutrition Research Center

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label
